911644422:

Senior Associate (WorkCover) - Melbourne

Company Name MinterEllison Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Us

MinterEllison is one of the Asia Pacific's leading law firms. Established in Sydney in 1827, our firm today operates in Australia, Hong Kong, mainland China, Mongolia, New Zealand and the United Kingdom through a network of integrated offices and associated offices.

At MinterEllison our aspiration is to be our clients’ best partner. Our large, diverse client base includes public and private companies, leading multinationals operating in the region, global financial institutions, and government and state-owned entities.

Your role

Our depth of local and national experience is clearly demonstrated by our national workers' compensation team. In our Melbourne office, our team is appointed to WorkSafe Victoria's select panel of lawyers and provides expert legal advice to WorkSafe, its agents and employers in all aspects of workers' compensation, as well as managing substantial portfolios of work for a variety of self-insured employers under both the Victorian and the Commonwealth workers' compensation schemes.

We are currently looking for an experienced lawyer ( Senior Associate level) with experience in the personal injuries field, preferably the Victorian workers' compensation scheme.

You will provide advice on statutory benefits, impairment benefit claims, common law claims, risk management and injury prevention, self-insured entry and compliance, common law investigations, portfolio management, occupational health and safety and industrial law issues and recovery action against third parties.

What We Are Looking For
  • A passionate and commercially astute workers' compensation lawyer with a genuine interest in building a successful, long term career in insurance law;
  • Someone with sound client and file management skills who understands the importance of providing technically excellent, advice;
  • A practitioner with the maturity and self-motivation to be responsible for the day to day management of claim files with the assistance of a mentor as appropriate; and
  • A good team player who appreciates the importance of collegiality and collaboration.


What We Offer

The Insurance team offers a collaborative and supportive team environment and market leading work. As a firm MinterEllison has a clear strategy that is focused on driving stronger client relationships, growth, collaboration and innovation.

As an employer we offer competitive top tier employment packages and a wide range of employment benefits such as a free annual gym membership and flexible work practices. Our internal support teams are second to none, and our learning and professional development programs are designed to maximise not only your legal technical expertise but also your broader skills (eg business acumen, innovation, leadership and so on) to help you build the foundation necessary to succeed as a practitioner in this ever changing market

How To Apply

We prefer to deal with you directly. Please submit your CV and academic transcripts for consideration by clicking on the 'Apply' button below. If you would like further information regarding these opportunities, Mariah Ioannidis on 03 8608 2372 for a highly confidential discussion.

To be eligible to apply for this role you must be legally permitted to work in Australia.

Industry

  • Law Practice
  • Legal Services

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Other

Research Analyst

Company Name Origin Energy Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 116 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Join a passionate team focused on innovation
  • Newly created opportunity offering significant variety
  • Melbourne based permanent role
  • Application close date: 16th October 2018


Origin - Australia's Leading Integrated Energy Company

An integral part of Australia’s energy future, we explore, produce, generate and sell energy to power millions of Australian homes and businesses every day, keeping them going and growing.

Origin offers exciting and rewarding career opportunities – from project management and leadership, to technical and engineering. Working for Origin can take you all over Australia – in the field, as well as in the office – or around the world. With global energy demand growing, Origin is looking for new ways to meet that need and create tomorrow’s energy solutions. It’s an exciting time to be a part of Origin.

The Role

Reporting to the General Manager Employee Development, this varied and newly created opportunity will be accountable for deriving data and providing insights to ensure the development of fact based solutions, while conveying concepts in writing to key stakeholders.

Specifically, you'll will be the key conduit and support across the team of the Employee Development team across the mandated Origin wide people projects by drafting key internal documents to communicate concepts and progress of solutions while providing data and insight to support the development of people solutions. Additionally, this role will be responsible for researching the market to keep our leaders across industry trends.

Day To Day Responsibilities Will Include
  • Support origin wide projects and solutions to be fact-based by seeking information and data from multiple stakeholders to derive solutions
  • Share insights and results in an easily digestible manner in both written and presentation format
  • and manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery of output key concepts or progress/updates on projects conveyed
  • Support initiative owners with research into the viability of solutions proposed and progressed
  • Assists GM's with creation of presentation materials and reports

Is This You?

Curious and creative with strong research and analytical capability, this role is suited to individuals who have strong learning agility and ability to navigate ambiguity to find information. A self-starter, a team player who can demonstrate a good understanding of applied research methodologies and have a proven ability to disseminate multiple data sources and convincingly communicate findings to a wide range of audiences.

Additionally, it is important that the successful candidate is comfortable working in strong project governance environments.

We embrace the diversity of our people and flexible working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we serve.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.
If dynamic and challenging career opportunities and workplace flexibility are important to you, go with the employer that thinks differently.

NAB is looking for Software Engineers for Dynamic Squads

About Bupa


We are a world leading Health & Care organisation with over 22,000 people in Australia and New Zealand, and our purpose is to help people live longer, healthier, and happier lives. In Australia, we help to take care of people through our leading health insurance services as well as providing a personalised approach to care through our modern Dental clinic network, our Bupa Optical stores, Bupa Medical Visa services and over 70 Bupa Aged Care Homes. Bupa Therapy, along with our Medical and Wellbeing Centre provide a multidiscipline approach to care.

\xa0

Opportunity Snapshot

\xa0

This role will provide additional support for escalated employment relations (broadly defined) activity across the business and will have secondary responsibility for complex case management. You are known for your ability to be outcome orientated without compromising on service. You will adhere to the Bupa values and be inspired to work for an organisation that is on a journey of transformation in the world of health and care.


As a Senior Employment Relations Specialist, your key accountabilities will be:

  • Assist the Head of Workplace Relations, People Policy and Conduct Risk and the Employment Relations Leader (and indirectly the relevant People Director) in implementing a strategic and consistent Employment Relations approach across the MU – particularly in relation to workplace investigations.
  • Advise, guide and support managers and leaders with matters relating to employment relations with an emphasis on employee case management
  • Provide specialist employee relations advice on key matters such as industrial frameworks and legacy matters.
  • Assist the Employment Relations Leader in the development and implementation of frameworks, policies, systems, processes and practices in relation to escalated case management, dispute prevention and settlement, mediation and investigations.

\xa0

Your profile:

  • Consultancy, advisory and/or management experience, inclusive of a demonstrable set of achievements in employment relations (broadly defined) in a large and complex organization,
  • Demonstrable experience in the successful support, development and implementation of employment relations strategies, frameworks, systems, processes and policies.
  • Demonstrable capability in dispute prevention and settlement, negotiation, and workplace investigation.
  • Able to work collaboratively and effectively with a diverse range of stakeholders including more senior leaders, technical and functional specialists, business facing People-team Heads of and Partners, operational and line managers
  • Proven ability to convert information and data into knowledge, and to communicate that knowledge in a meaningful and useful way.


Bupa believes in hiring the best talent in the market. We are known for our vibrant, high performing and incredibly rewarding and flexible workplace and we take pride in creating exceptional and meaningful work experiences. With a belief in innovation, we deliver award winning benefits to our employees and encourage involvement within our communities.

Bupa has everything – growth, passion, results and a caring & supportive culture that surround a burning ambition and purpose that is the best in the world.


Our people reflect the diversity of our community. At Bupa, your wellbeing, identity and own story is respected and valued.

Senior Sitecore Developer

Company Name Company Location 33 Exhibition St, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

New Posted Date Posted 14 hours ago Number of views 8 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Bupa is extraordinary. We are a world leading healthcare group and our businesses serve over 14 million customers in more than 190 countries. At Bupa, we exist to help people live longer, happier and healthier lives, and everything we do is for the health of our members.


We’re Bupa Digital, we’re part of Bupa and we do what Bupa do just a bit differently.

We are set up to sustainably reinvent ourselves through our cross-functional design and delivery capability. We are design led and Agile run focusing on customer centricity and technical flexibility.


We combine human-centred design with agile and lean methodologies to be rapid and effective.


Our team come to the office ready to solve problems. We constantly seek ways to make things better, faster and easier for ourselves and our customers. We question and challenge; roll up our sleeves and all have a voice in the experiences we create. We ensure that our products, technology and customer experience continue to set us apart from our competitors. \xa0


This is an opportunity to be part of a team with an enormous amount of experience. We're united by our commitment to create the digital future of Health through incredible online experiences. Our people are at the core of our business, driving innovation and success through continuous improvement, collaboration and customer-centricity.



As our Senior Sitecore Developer…

Will be responsible for analysis, coding, testing and implementation activities. You will work within cross-functional Agile teams on projects and extensional initiatives to deliver high quality applications built using .NET, Sitecore, JavaScript, HMTL and CSS as well as utilising Azure cloud services.\xa0


Your core responsibilities will include:

  • Provide Sitecore/.Net technical expertise.
  • Develop high quality code that leverage existing Bupa code libraries, patterns and architectural techniques where they exist. Look for opportunities to extend and improve existing code libraries, patterns and architectural technique.
  • Develop functional and appealing web applications based on usability and build reusable code and libraries for future use.
  • Undertake design and development activities including coding, testing, deployment scripting and configuration areas in .NET domains and other related technologies.
  • Are responsible for staying up-to-date on emerging technologies and promoting usability best practices.


In order to make this role a success, you have:

  • Commercial experience in developing web applications using the .NET frameworks
  • Extensive experience in developing Sitecore applications and familiarity with Sitecore versions 8+
  • Extensive experience in developing with C#, ASP.NET MVC and Web API 2
  • Have demonstrable expert competence level in using development and automated testing tools in the Sitecore / .NET domain
  • A proficient understanding of client-side scripting, JavaScript libraries and web frameworks including jQuery, Bootstrap, AngularJS.
  • Basic understanding of HTML, CSS and CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS
  • Experience with SQL databases (preference MS SQL)
  • Understanding and experience in unit testing and mocking technologies, such as xUnit and Moq.
  • Exposure to the Cloud Hosting platforms.
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git / Mercurial / SVN / TFS.
  • A tertiary qualification in IT or an equivalent level of work experience.


Bupa believes in hiring the best talent in the market. We are known for our vibrant, high performing and incredibly rewarding workplace, and we take pride in creating exceptional and meaningful work experiences, encouraging innovation, delivering award winning benefits to our employees and being involved with our communities.


We invite you to discover what makes Bupa a place where talented people find inspiring personal and professional opportunities and rewards. For further company information please visit Bupa Digital Careers and \xa0www.bupa.com.au


Find the purpose in your career!


Monique Carruthers
monique.carruthers@bupa.com.au

Job Description

We are building an inclusive workplace that embraces diversity of backgrounds and differences to realise the potential of our employees for innovation and delivering services aimed at enhancing the lives of vulnerable Victorians. The department is committed to the safety of its clients. The department takes a zero tolerance approach to abuse, including child abuse and abuse of people with disability. Senior Property Manager - With an Assistant

Company Name Kay & Burton Company Location Brighton, Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 14 hours ago Number of views 16 views

Be an early applicant

Job description



  • Newly Acquired Portfolio: Approximately 160 and an Assistant to Support You
  • Offices right on Church Street
  • Free Income Protection Insurance and Other Perks!



Kay & Burton
Kay & Burton is a relationship based, specialist advisory real estate business that markets the finest homes and lifestyle properties in Victoria. We provide these services to local and international individuals, families and businesses.

Our directors are highly experienced negotiators and managers, every one of them "hands on" in Kay & Burton's day-to-day business and involved in its long-term strategies for innovation and growth.

Every person we employ is an integral part of the Kay & Burton brand, with each person bringing to the table a unique set of skills and a commitment to service and excellence. Numbering more than 130 people across 7 offices, the Kay & Burton team is divided between four operating groups - Sales, Property Management, Projects & Developments and Operations and is committed to supporting our people through providing a workplace which is envied and respected.

Our Mission
Achieve outstanding results for our clients by nurturing relationships that last a lifetime. Exceed our clients' expectations through timely anticipation of their needs and flawless execution of our mandate.

Our Vision
Be recognised for our leadership and innovation and extend our footprint within Australia and beyond.

Position Summary
Reporting to the Manager of the property management division, the Senior Property Manager provides efficient, professional and dedicated client service to landlords and tenants, to encourage growth of the property management division.

The duties and responsibilities of this role require not only a talent for exceptional relationship and communication skills, but also strong attention to detail and well-developed organisational skills where there is a requirement to collaboratively work with a variety of stakeholders.

Responsibilities:



  • Ensure you maintain positive relationships with all clients and communicate regularly.
  • Complete condition reports for all new business and relet properties supported by digital photography as per company guidelines.
  • Ensure tenants rental payments are made on the due date or follow the arrears procedure to chase any overdue payments.
  • Issue notice to vacate for any arrears over 14 days.
  • Prepare applications to VCAT & attend VCAT as required for rent arrears.
  • Log all maintenance requests to Property Me when reported and arrange within a timely manner ensuring instructions are obtained by the owner.
  • Attend to urgent maintenance as required within company policy and legislative requirements.
  • Utilise Kay & Burton preferred contractors when arranging maintenance unless the owner has specified to use their contractor.
  • Follow up maintenance completed, keep tenants updated at all times.
  • Follow up invoices/quotes for maintenance as needed and ensure all documentation is logged within Filesmart.
  • Inspect any large jobs before invoices are paid.
  • Arrange routine inspections on a weekly basis.
  • Attend regular routine inspections in line with legislative requirements/company policy and complete thorough reports with photographs for landlords.
  • Ensure any issues noted at routine inspections are followed up and logged within Property Me.
  • Ensure all routine inspections are logged in Property Me and dates updated.
  • Undertake rent reviews 90 days prior to all lease expirations.
  • Communicate advice regarding potential rental increases to owners and seek instruction as required.
  • Arrange rent increases as required using VCAT online.
  • Arrange lease renewals as required ensuring legislative requirements are met.
  • Update Property Me following all rent reviews
  • Action notice to vacate requests from tenants and landlords as necessary.
  • Provide advice in relation to reletting the property.
  • Complete all vacating documentation as needed and follow company procedure to arrange for the property to be relet.
  • Ensure professional photos are on file for all properties being relet before marketing takes place.
  • Undertake final inspections when a tenant vacates to ensure the property has been left in line with the ingoing condition report.
  • Arrange refund of bond or dispute the bond as needed following final inspections.
  • Apply to & attend VCAT to claim bond as needed.
  • Finalise file and archive as per company guidelines once bond has been finalised.
  • For any lost management properties ensure company guidelines are met.


Responsibilities (General)


  • Provide support for the receptionist as required by taking calls in a timely manner.
  • Provide backup support to other staff if required and work as a team at all times..
  • Return all calls and emails promptly.
  • Other administrational duties as required within the confines of your role.
  • Complete KPI reports as required.
  • Attend all company meetings, events or training as required.
  • Work 1 in 4 Saturdays


Attributes

Activation Manager

Company Name Omnicom Media Group Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 42 views

Job description

Want to join one of Australia's largest and most forward thinking Digital Media agencies?

\xa0

We are Resolution.\xa0We're a part of global marketing company OMG (Omnicom Media Group), and we're looking for an Activation Manager to join our team. We're a growing, full service digital agency, who create innovative, data-lead infrastructure and digital content, in partnership with our sister media agencies OMD, PHD, m2m and Foundation.

This is a great opportunity to work on market-leading brands and develop your career!

\xa0

Why you'll love us

Through our people philosophy “Because I am, we are”, we believe that happy people with a great work/life balance are able to bring the #WOW factor to work. They're also much more fun to share an office with. Join us and surround yourself with like-minded, high achieving individuals. Together, we can change the way digital works.

We can offer:

  • Unbeatable career development opportunities and mentoring
  • Flexible working arrangements centered on work / life balance
  • State of the art tools – we have a dedicated internal tools team
  • A social culture with a well-being focus - yoga, nutrition, meditation + more

\xa0

Why we'll love you

You have a passion for all things Digital and you're ready to make a real impact. As the Activation Manager, you'll be a results focused, highly inquisitive individual who strives to deliver excellent service, communicate at all levels, and play a key role in educating the team, the agency and ultimately the clients about programmatic. The role requires someone who is comfortable with data, but able to understand the nuances and rationale of marketing. They should be a strong team player, seeking and providing assistance across the OMG business . Here's what you'll need:

\xa0

  • Understands adserving and account structure hierarchies
  • Understands reporting capabilities within the platforms
  • Knowledgeable on ancillary tools (brand safety, viewability, attribution etc).
  • Competent and able to educate others on private marketplace and inventory types.
  • Well organized and good timekeeping. Sets relevant daily, weekly and monthly processes and continuously delivers against them.
  • Proficient in all trading platforms. Understand value proposition of each and can provide technology recommendations based on this knowledge.
  • Skilled optimizer

\xa0

Why our love will last

Not just anyone can fill this role. We want someone who can take it and make it their own. To do this, you want to see you:

  • Reports delivered consistently, accurately and on time. Any delays through technology issues are communicated early, and workarounds are investigated.
  • Continued use and development of the weekly report for each client.
  • Committed to delivering meaningful insights and recommendations to each client.
  • Transparency and openness in data sharing with the client and the client teams is a crucial deliverable for Accuen, and a critical part of the trader's communication with the agency teams.
  • Post Campaign Analysis to be completed for each client as needed. At least 8 per year should be delivered to meet individual KPIs.
  • The Trader should always ask ‘what else'. What else does the client need or want? What else can we deliver? There should be a tacit understanding that redefining what Accuen can offer is ongoing.
  • Take ownership of any issues and aim to resolve within 48 hours.
  • Seek automation, and find methods to deliver it, in data, in reporting, in any activity that can benefit from it.
  • Proficient in data and trend analysis. Able to define analysis and put in place the findings/recommendations to improve overall performance and delivery.
  • Effective communicator internally and externally. Able to build appropriate relationships with the account management teams, and internally within Accuen.
  • Conversant in implementation of various strategies aligned with client and campaign objectives. Seeks to avoid the ‘cookie cutter' approach, and defines the right strategy according to the requirements.
  • Able to interrogate a brief and build a response that is rational and relevant.
  • Able to traffic, structure and develop accounts and campaigns in a manner that will enable appropriate results (from a data collection and reporting perspective).
  • Continually learning. Spends time with the platform specialists and the clients. Aims to be the bridge – understands the client in order to know what questions to ask the platform.
  • Weekly use of the optimization templates (site threshold performance, site performance and additional reports)


Does this sound like a you? Bring your passion and drive to an Australian Business Awards Employer of Choice (2017). We want you to thrive with us. Get in touch today. We can't wait to meet you.


\xa0

Job description

Checkmarx, founded in 2006, is a leader in application security solutions, having developed the first platform for true Source Code Analysis (SCA) with its marquee solution: Static Application Security Testing (SAST). Our mission is in enabling organizations to secure applications from the start, reducing risk and cost along the way. Our platforms offer maximum application security for software developers and security experts throughout the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).

\xa0

Checkmarx is one of Gartner’s “Cool Vendors in Application Security”. In fact, Checkmarx has been named a Leader in the Gartner 2018 Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing! Checkmarx was named the 8th fastest growing Israeli start-up by Deloitte in 2014, and was awarded a Red Herring Top 100 2014 Europe Award.

\xa0The Role and Responsibilities

As part of the expansion initiative, Checkmarx is seeking for an ambitious, confident, and tenacious Regional Sales Manager to be responsible for the acquisition of new customers in Australia & New Zealand. The candidate must be entrepreneurial minded, has a go-getter attitude and possesses a strong business acumen. Energetic and proactive, the RSM must be able to combine various software sales and business development strategies to develop market shares and win key accounts.

\xa0

The ideal candidate shall possess the energy, business acumen and must have demonstrated the ability to promote a Business and IT management value proposition to Business and IT Leaders at C Level. He/She must have also demonstrated an ability to build strong and durable relations with regional key accounts and with an ecosystem of business partners. \xa0Always thinking out-of-the-box, the candidate is a cross-functional and cross-regional leader, optimistic and positive in the difficult situations and must be a trusted advisor.

\xa0

To be based in Melbourne or Sydney, this candidate will report directly to the Regional Sales Head, Australia and New Zealand.

\xa0

  • Pipeline Management. Build and maintain a pipeline across solutions and services that represent opportunities at different stages of the sales cycle. Excellent time management is key to ensuring consistent quarterly performance.
  • Quarterly Performance. Consistently sell to achieve/overachieve the quarterly goals.
  • Lead/Demand Generation. Creating new business meetings through self-generation, personal networks and working closely with in-house lead generation.
  • Presentations. Responsible for creating and presenting solutions/services to prospects/customers/business partners at a very high standard of professionalism.

Help other members of the team, share information, encourage and support all individuals in their role; daily communication with team to share ideas, experiences, learning, support and advice.


Requirements:

  • At least 8 years of relevant experience in Enterprise Software Sales and Channel Sales in Australia and New Zealand.
  • Experience in Security Domain is a major advantage.
  • Experience in working on Government institution is a major advantage.
  • Self-motivated with the ability to stay focused to on goals and objectives, and achieving progressively higher quota or other sales related goals.

  • Ability to lead and drive the selling of complex solutions and services, with minimal tactical direction.
  • Maintain timely and accurate account documentation in CRM and to management.
  • Understand market dynamics and needs. Work with Marketing to brainstorm lead generation campaigns, support lead generation campaigns and generate relevant marketing plans for developing the region.
  • Manage and sell through specific partner organizations to end users in coordination with partner sales resources.
  • Bachelor’s degree; Master’s degree is preferred.
  • Executive level presentation and excellent communication skills.
  • Posses strong technical capabilities, lead technical discussions and demo of the solution.
  • Demonstrated level of project management skills.

Job description

  • Newly created opportunity to join a multi-awarded and market leading superannuation fund and be part of our Risk and Compliance Team
  • Excellent opportunity to utilise your previous 2nd line monitoring, internal or external audit experience
  • Melbourne CBD location, permanent full-time role
About us:

At Hostplus, we passionately provide our one million members with the best possible service; constantly looking for new ways to deliver better value while helping them get the most out of their super. We are inspired to help our members achieve greater security for their future and ensure they retire with dignity.

The role:

We currently have an exciting new opportunity available for a resilient, personable and proactive individual to provide specialist guidance and support to help the business strengthen its control environment to further mitigate risk.

Utilising your knowledge and experience from previous audit or monitoring roles, you will assist the business to understand its risk, compliance and control environment by undertaking assurance testing to gain insights to the effectiveness of controls. You will partner with various stakeholders to understand business processes and provide recommendations for improvements.

Your key responsibilities will include:
  • Conduct testing over the effectiveness of the design and operation of internal business controls, in line with defined processes and timelines.
  • Develop testing documentation, including the design of test scripts, to enable repeatable quality testing and assurance.
  • Provide recommendations and reporting to the business and Risk Committees on the effectiveness of controls.
  • Proactively engage business partners to understand, review and test current process controls.
  • Provide effective support and instruction to stakeholders and assist with approved recommended actions to strengthen controls.
  • Support the Risk and Compliance team to educate the business of Risk and Compliance frameworks, programs and policies.

Ideally, you will have a strong understanding and experience in audit or controls testing. Experience working in a high pressure and fast-changing environment, with the ability to be analytical and work autonomously across various compliance and assurance projects, is essential. You will be able to effectively manage workloads ensuring internal stakeholder expectations are met.

An understanding of superannuation or financial services would be highly regarded, but is not essential.

Why work at Hostplus:

Our employees are passionate about what we do and are proud to be part of an organisation which helps everyday Australians achieve a brighter future. Some great benefits we offer:
  • 15% superannuation
  • Access to a Financial Planner
  • Salary packaging

  • Demonstrated experience in grants administration and an understanding of community development practice
  • Highly developed communication skills
  • Strong political acumen and the ability to build and maintain collaborative working relationships
  • A tertiary qualification in social science, community development or a related discipline
  • Ability to attend out of hours meeting and be flexible with working hours when required


Applications Requirements

Applications must be submitted through our online system https://mooneevalley.mercury.com.au/ and include a separate cover letter, resume, copy of relevant qualifications and address the Selection Criteria to be considered for this position.

Applications that do not meet these requirements may not be considered.

Detailed information on how to apply and application requirements is available in the Application Guide found at the bottom of the advertisement on our website.

For further information please view the Position Description or contact Sarah Edwards, Coordinator Social Planning and Wellbeing on 9243 8758.

Moonee Valley City Council is an Equal Opportunity and Child Safe employer and we value diversity and encourage people from different backgrounds to apply, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from culturally and linguistically diverse (CALD) backgrounds, people of any age or gender, people identifying as lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans and gender diverse, intersex and/or queer (LGBTIQA+) and people with disability.

General Manager

Company Name Become Recruitment Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 127 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Global experiential agency is needing a natural leader from an Account/Client service background to lead their business by example, not by authority.


This agency has a global presence and already work with big brands but want someone who can grow business with those current clients as well as lead their new business activity.


You will need to be well connected in Melbourne, come from a client service background in either experiential (preferred) or creative agencies and have a strong interest in the experiential space.


You could be a current GM but you have to be hands-on with your clients. This isn’t a sit-in an office and manage operations and spreadsheets role. Your first 30 days would be getting to know your current clients and looking for opportunities with new clients.


The business runs smoothly already and you have support from the MD. But the role will grow with you, as you grow the revenue of the business. You will have responsibilities on P&L, performance reviews etc but they are secondary responsibilities to client relationships. If you’re not strong or experience in this area, you will receive great mentorship and an opportunity to learn in a supportive environment.


Where you’ve worked will be important but your energy, drive and charisma will be as influential in deciding who gets the role.


How many of these boxes do you tick?


☐ 8 years or more in experiential / creative agency is client service roles

☐ Currently Group Account Director, Client Services Director, Business Director or GM

☐Love networking and new business (with existing and new clients)

☐Have a strong network in Melbourne

☐Experience and knowledge of experiential


If 4 or more, it’s definitely worth us having a chat.


$170-$200k incl super + bonus

National Wholesale Manager

Company Name Country Road Group Company Location 572 Swan St, Richmond Victoria 3121

Job description

The Role

We have a unique opportunity for a National Wholesale Manager to join the team at Politix. Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, this position is accountable for the management, growth and innovation of the Wholesale Politix business.


Key Responsibilities

  • Maintain, manage and grow the end to end Wholesale business
  • Present, promote and sell Politix ranges to external wholesale vendors
  • Set up and maintenance of Merchandise and Showroom
  • Organically grow existing wholesale customer base
  • Collate orders and ensue all orders are dispatched and invoiced in a timely fashion
  • Manage timely payment of accounts and follow up outstanding amounts.
  • Assist Finance in liaising any late payment advice to customers.
  • Establish and maintain excellent customer relationships
  • Regular communication with the Design and Product team
  • Ensuring Product knowledge is sound, and a proactive approach to staying up to date with new product information
  • Proactively seek out new accounts nationally, and identify new and innovative ways to promote the Politix brand

\xa0

The Ideal Candidate has

  • Previous demonstrated experience in Wholesale Sales, in a Retail environment
  • An affinity to the Politix business and brand, with a desire to learn and grow
  • Exceptional sales skills, with an ability to look for the best customer and business opportunities and outcomes
  • A relevant tertiary qualification
  • A ‘customer first’ mentality, with a focus on delivering an exceptional customer experience
  • Strong numerical and analytical skills, alongside an excellent retail and commercial acumen
  • The ability to work alongside a range of key stakeholders, internally and externally, in order to achieve business outcomes
  • Have the ability to meet deadlines and work within a fast paced environment whilst balancing competing interests
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, with the ability to influence stakeholders across the organisation

\xa0

Why work for us?

  • A competitive remuneration package, including incentives
  • Bi-annual product allowances and generous discounts for you and your immediate family on all Country Road, Mimco, Politix, Trenery and Witchery products. Further offers and discounts available at David Jones.
  • Birthday roster day off
  • Excellent career progression involving regular training and on the job development
  • A genuine, open and high performing culture
  • Opportunity to become involved in our Corporate Social Responsibility program, by supporting our community partnerships


About Us

For over 40 years our definition of success at Politix is simple: We are a customer focused business. Great product and customer service is at the heart of our spirit and we’re big on supporting and helping our team to grow professionally so that we can make an impact, and we’re proud of strong spirit that defines us.

Business Process Management/Improvement Specialist

Company Name BAE Systems Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 40 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

\xa0

  • Enjoy friendly work practices, strong team culture and interesting work at a global company
  • Seeking a Business Process Management/Improvement Specialist on a 12 month fixed term contract
  • Williamstown, Victoria location

\xa0

BAE Systems Australia is a global Defence and security company with wide-ranging products and services to support and protect Australia’s Defence forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology, and support services.

\xa0

Passionate people work at BAE Systems and the team contributes to something really big – the defence of Australia. An exciting opportunity has arisen for an innovative Business Process Management/Improvement Specialist to join the Maritime Sustainment business on a 12 month fixed term basis and make a valuable contribution. This challenging and rewarding position will be situated at our Williamstown, Victoria location. Are you up for the challenge?

\xa0

In terms of more specific responsibilities, you will:

  • Engage with stakeholders across the business in the development, deployment and use of business processes and facilitate process improvement

  • Perform as a role model and change agent for business process improvement

  • Drive the evaluation of business needs, undertake business process analysis, and provide your expertise to support the sustainment and growth of process management and process improvement capability and capacity

  • Provide expertise to support process management, modelling and improvement initiatives including Business Process Management and Process Improvement methodologies

  • Manage the provision, development and sustainment of training and awareness materials in process management

  • Lead the capture and evaluation of trends and ideas for the successful management of processes

  • Develop documentation required to ensure the governance of process related activities and initiatives in conjunction with the Business Process team and the wider business \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

\xa0

As an ideal applicant you will have:

  • Extensive Business Process Management/Improvement practitioner experience

  • A strong understanding of Business Process Management and associated techniques, methodologies, tools and lean principles

  • The ability to be innovative and effectively engage with and motivate stakeholders at all levels to facilitate organisational change

  • The ability to challenge and analyse situations and identify opportunities for improvement \xa0 \xa0

    \xa0

Applications should be addressed to: Kon Yiannikopoulos, Recruitment Specialist.

\xa0

Please ensure you attach a current resume and copy of your relevant qualification(s) to your application. A cover letter is preferred.

\xa0

At BAE Systems, we have a strong safety, health and environmental culture; employee safety and well-being is a top priority. We also maintain a genuine commitment to diversity and inclusion and to training and development, offer competitive benefits and enjoy a family friendly work place with flexible work practices.

\xa0

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

\xa0

To learn about other employment opportunities at BAE Systems, please visit: BAE Systems Careers Australia

\xa0

BAE Systems Australia employees are encouraged to refer others for employment in line with the conditions of the Employee Referral Scheme.

\xa0

\xa0

Be an early applicant

Job description

Grant Thornton Australia is growing and growth brings career opportunities for dynamic individuals who are seeking a career in Corporate Tax.


This opportunity will allow you to join a well-established and supportive team of experts who are committed to the highest standards of technical expertise and will enable you to gain a wide range of advisory exposure including:


  • Preparation of company tax returns, including consolidated company tax returns for a wide range of corporate clients
  • Preparation of tax-effect accounting calculations
  • Assisting with tax due diligence, structuring advice and advisory work
  • Research and assisting with tax consulting advice (such as tax consolidation, tax treaties, international tax, withholding taxes)

This is a fantastic opportunity to continue your career in Corporate Tax. You’ll be agile, responsive and bring innovative ideas to the table. Your passion for understanding your clients’ businesses will see you go beyond addressing technical issues to developing actionable growth recommendations.


\xa0


Desired Skills and Experience

This role will suit someone with the following skills, experience and attributes:


  • Has worked in corporate tax compliance and consulting or a business advisory role, ideally within a chartered accounting environment
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Excellent client relationship and communication skills
  • Strong work ethic and a genuine interest in their clients
  • A self-starter keen to develop an understanding of client needs and “ figure out the why “
  • Interest in a career of lifelong learning with a focus on developing your knowledge and skills in corporate tax advisory
  • The ability to understand accounting concepts
  • An understanding of the broader business environment
  • Be CA/CPA qualified or near qualification

At Grant Thornton, we encourage our people to bring their whole selves to work. We recognise, appreciate and harness our people's individual skills and talents. You will thrive in our down to earth yet entrepreneurial environment which empowers our people to succeed within a social work culture.


We recognise the increasing importance of flexible work options and family friendly work practices in maintaining a diverse, adaptive and high performing workforce able to meet our current and future business needs.


If you’d like to know more or arrange a private and confidential discussion about this role, click Apply Now.


Only direct applications will be accepted (no agencies please). Please note that we have not engaged any recruitment agencies to represent us for this role.


If you experience any technical difficulties applying please contact the Grant Thornton People & Culture team on GTTalentScouts@au.gt.com

Job description

Do you want to be a pivotal part of a collaborative team that is rapidly growing, creating valuable insights and building the foundation for success?
\xa0
No two days are the same at Tandem, so your agility in problem solving skills would set you up for success.

What you'll be doing:
\xa0\xa0
As a Visualisation & Reporting Analyst within Tandem you will be partnering with business leaders to help drive their strategic outcomes. \xa0You will be the key to unlocking their success. Day to day you will move between technologies, discover data, aggregate information, discuss your ideas and produce valuable insights into performance always with an eye on the “so what?” question.

You should be creative, graphically minded and adaptive to rapid change as the business shifts. You are the enabler who can provide exceptional outcomes, delivered simply.
\xa0

Who you'll be working with:\xa0

TANDEM is a leading Australian company providing advisory and field based workforce management services with a culture of encouraging employee development. Our innovative approach, robust systems and agile operational capabilities allow us to partner with blue chip clients to continually refine and implement strategic solutions that deliver ongoing improvements in customer experience, productivity and quality. Managing a subcontractor workforce of 2,900 subcontracting companies who engage in excess of 5,200 workers, TANDEM is a rapidly growing organisation.

What we're looking for:

  • Demonstrated experience with Tableau (Desktop and Server).
  • Strong data mining/cleansing/preparation capability using SQL
  • Experience as an analyst
  • Strong project management skills, preferably using the Agile methodology.
  • Exceptional customer engagement skills
  • Ability to work accurately and achieve operational goals under the pressure of tight deadlines.
  • Ability to effectively analyse information on performance to identify issues/problems and identify corrective action with relevant people.
  • Strong numerate and analytical skills and able to undertake non-traditional analytical tasks.
  • High-level written, verbal communication skills and demonstrated ability to manage and influence stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated attention to detail and follow through.
  • Qualifications in accounting/business/commerce/Computer Science.
  • Advanced skills in Microsoft Office suite.
  • Experience in the telecommunications sector an advantage..


Why you should apply:

\xa0
Join TANDEM and you will be part of a high energy team with a supportive culture. In addition to competitive salaries, we offer incentives and rewards that are designed to recognise high performance. Our leadership team works with you to make sure you have the tools and support to do your job exceptionally well so that you can achieve your goals. Come on, apply today!

Please Note - the successful candidate/s for this position will be asked to consent to a police check.
